comments: This is the continued fraction expansion of the constant A176320 = 5/2 + sqrt(255)/6. - R. J. Mathar, Nov 21 2011
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,1).
formula: a(n) = -1/2*(-1)^n + 11/2 = 6*(n mod 2)+5*[(n+1) mod 2]. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 20 2006a(n) = a(n-2) for n>1; a(0)=5, a(1)=6. G.f.: (5+6*x)/((1-x)*(1+x)). - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 01 2010a(n) = floor(11*(n+1)/2) - floor(11*n/2). - _James Van Alstine_, Jul 17 2014
prog: (PARI) contfrac(5/2+sqrt(precision(255.,150))/6) \\ NB: Depending on the chosen precision, the last term may be off by +/- 1, so it would be safer to discard it, e.g., using vecextract(...,"^-1"). - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 25 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
